title: Relative Risk Misleading
content: In a new blog article, we learned relative risk can be absolutely misleading.

title: Scientific Thinking
content: A post explaining why we’re not wired to think scientifically.

title: Epidemiology in Public Health Policy
content: A closer look at what’s been the foundation of shaping public health policy: epidemiology.

title: Reducing Lp(a)-mediated Risk of Cardiovascular Disease
content: The most interesting article I read this week was this paper on the NHLBI’s recommendations to reduce Lp(a)-mediated risk of cardiovascular disease. Unfortunately, the paper is currently behind a paywall, but if you visit the link you can listen to a 30-minute summary. Here’s a good article discussing the paper. Will be exploring this topic in-depth soon.

title: Addictive Behavior
content: On the personal front, I just finished a book about addictive behavior, In The Realm of Hungry Ghosts, and it’s simultaneously upsetting and illuminating. I’ve become especially interested, personally and professionally, in the field of addiction.
